title: Soldier 'raped woman following BBQ at army barracks after telling her the way she was dressed was inviting attention'
text:
A soldier has gone on trial accused of raping one woman and sexually assaulting another during the same night at South Cerney, near Cirencester.

At Gloucester Crown Court yesterday Corporal Serupepeli Niubasaga, 40, a Fijian who lives at Wellington Place, Hullavington, Wiltshire, pleaded not guilty to the the alleged offences, which occurred in May last year.

Prosecutor Ray Tully told the jury that the two alleged victims knew each other and one was visiting the other at South Cerney.

They were invited out to a barbecue in the Duke of Gloucester barracks and decided to attend.

Cpl Niubasaga had also been invited to the event and was making a rum punch when the women arrived.

Mr Tully said: "Niubasaga made it known that he objected to the way one of the women was dressed and he believed that others at the barbecue were of the same opinion.

"A little while later one of the women became a little worse for drink and had slumped in a chair and had gone to sleep.

"Barbecue-goers kept an eye on the woman and in the mid-evening she was escorted back to where she was staying.

"Corporal Niubasaga also volunteered to help take her back with the other woman and placed her in bed."
description: A soldier has gone on trial accused of raping one woman and sexually assaulting another during the same night at South Cerney, near Cirencester.
